author: Ben Yagoda
title: An Appreciation: Tom Wolfe
text:
One of the best passages in Tom Wolfe’s best book, “The Right Stuff” (1979), starts out:
“Anyone who travels very much on airlines in the United States soon gets to know the voice of the airline pilot . . . coming over the intercom . . . with a particular drawl, a particular folksiness, a particular down-home calmness that is so exaggerated it begins to parody itself (nevertheless!—it’s reassuring) . . . the voice that tells you, as the airliner is caught in thunderheads and goes bolting up and down a thousand feet at a single...
